Load package
```{r}
library(readxl)
```
```{r}
read_excel('./boston.xlsx',sheet = 1) ->boston 

x1<-boston$CRIM
x2<-boston$INDUS
x3<-boston$NOX
x4<-boston$RM
x5<-boston$AGE
x6<-boston$DIS
x7<-boston$PTRATIO
x8<-boston$B
x9<-boston$LSTAT
y<-boston$MEDV

lm(y~x1+x2+x3+x4+x5+x6+x7+x8+x9,boston)->boston.lr

library(car)
library(carData)
library(car)

summary(boston.lr)
##car::vif(denver.population.lr)
```

The preview shows you a rendered HTML copy of the contents of the editor. Consequently, unlike *Knit*, *Preview* does not run any R code chunks. Instead, the output of the chunk when it was last run in the editor is displayed.

```{r}
read_excel('./boston.xlsx') ->boston 
boston_subset = subset(boston,select = c(NOX,AGE,RM,PTRATIO,LSTAT))
library(MASS)
lm(y~.,boston_subset)->boston.full.mode
lm(y~1,boston_subset)->boston.null.mode
stepAIC(boston.model,direction = "both",trace = 1,scope=list(lower=boston.null.mode,                                           upper=boston.full.mode))->boston.selected.model 

```
